tbgitoo.tools

Class ArrayIndexComparator

  • java.lang.Object
    • tbgitoo.tools.ArrayIndexComparator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.Comparator<java.lang.Integer>

    public class ArrayIndexComparator
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.Comparator<java.lang.Integer>
    Modified comparator for Index array: compares the underlying values (i.e. arr[ind] rather than the integer values We need this in the class FindPeaksTools to find the indexes of the largest values
    Author:
    thomasbraschler

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected java.lang.Double[] array
      Array with the values for which we would like to get the ordered indices

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ArrayIndexComparator(double[] vals)
      Load this class with the double array for which we'd like to do comparison

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int compare(java.lang.Integer index1, java.lang.Integer index2)
      Value-based index comparision: An index value is "larger" than another index value if it points to a larger array element
      java.lang.Integer[] createIndexArray()
      Convenience function.

      • ArrayIndexComparator

        public ArrayIndexComparator(double[] vals)

        Parameters:
        vals - The values for wich we would like to get the indices indicating their orgering

    • Method Detail

      • createIndexArray

        public java.lang.Integer[] createIndexArray()
        Convenience function. We want to get the indices sorted along the values, and so we need to start out with the indices array (i.e. 0,1,2,3 ...). For reasons of Java typing, we need this not as primitive int[] array, but as a class array using the Integer class
        Returns:
        Returns an ascending array of indices (0 to length array-1)

      • compare

        public int compare(java.lang.Integer index1,
                   java.lang.Integer index2)
        Value-based index comparision: An index value is "larger" than another index value if it points to a larger array element
        Specified by:
        compare in interface java.util.Comparator<java.lang.Integer>
